channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Biden warns of an ‘oligarchy,’ Trump will be flanked by tech billionaires at his inauguration
item.description: The super-rich have long played a role in U.S. politics but have an unusually prominent spot in incoming President Donald Trump’s new administration.

item.title: Cancer deaths are declining, but diagnoses are rising especially among younger women
item.description: The American Cancer Society's report shows a mix of lower death rates and rising cancer incidence rates for some groups, especially younger women.

item.title: Justin Baldoni sues Blake Lively as "It Ends With Us" feud deepens
item.description: Justin Baldoni's lawsuit comes after "It Ends With Us" co-star Blake Lively accused him of sexual harassment.

item.title: Israel delays vote to approve Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said a "loose end" was being tied up but he was confident the ceasefire would begin on Sunday as planned.

item.title: Capital One customers report deposits not showing up in their accounts
item.description: Capital One says the bank is working to restore service after thousands of customers reported problems depositing money.

item.title: As wildfires linger, focus turns to rebuilding Los Angeles’ leveled neighborhoods
Twin Peaks film director David Lynch dies at 78
item.description: The Oscar-nominated writer and filmmaker is also famous for the surrealist cult classic, Mulholland Drive.

item.title: Trump's pick for Treasury Secretary is Scott Bessent. Here's what to know
item.description: Trump's promised tax cuts, and their potential consequences for the U.S. economy, took center stage at Bessent's confirmation hearing.

item.title: Investors urge Walmart not to "give into bullying" on diversity
item.description: Some Walmart shareholders say the retailer hasn't offered a good business case for canceling its diversity, equity and inclusion programs.

item.title: Canadian man's home security camera captures the sight and sound of a meteorite strike
item.description: Joe Velaidum's home security camera captured the instant a meteorite smashed against his home's brick walkway. The video is thought to be the first re...

item.title: Ghanaian music legend who founded Afro-rock band Osibisa dies
item.description: Osibisa was one of the first African bands to gain international recognition, in the 1970s.

item.title: Is a short-term CD worth it for 2025?
item.description: For some savers, a short-term CD account could still be worth opening now. Here's why.

item.title: From LA wildfires to hurricanes, immigrants help rebuild after disasters. Some may face deportation
US sanctions Sudan army chief Burhan over civilian deaths
item.description: The army under Gen Abdel Fattah al-Burhan is accused of committing lethal attacks on civilians.

item.title: The immigration journey: How long does it take to feel like an American?
item.description: What does it take to feel like an American - and to be treated like one? Several communities shared their perspectives on the immigrant experience.

item.title: Will Israel's Government Ratify the Gaza Ceasefire Deal?
item.description: Just one day after the announcement of a deal between Israel and Hamas to end the war in Gaza, Israel's prime minister threatened to delay a cabinet v...

item.title: How did we reach the Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal in Gaza?
item.description: The ceasefire agreement in the Gaza war follows 15 months of fighting between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Supreme Court may announce opinions Friday as TikTok decision looms
item.description: The Supreme Court said it may announce opinions on Friday, a last-minute addition that comes just two days before a law that would ban TikTok is set t...
